update.description:
[gazebo pull request 2207](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2207/semantic_version_7/diff) changed the behavior of choosing which version of a model to use when an exact match the SDF_VERSION isn't found, but it wasn't changed here. I wrote this a while ago, but hadn't written a test. Also it feels weird that this logic is both here and in gazebo. Maybe it should only be here?

At any rate, I don't want to forget about this, so I'm opening a PR.
update.title: Add patch for issue #123 from gazebo PR 2207 that uses ignition::math::SemanticVersion

content.raw:
CI summary:

* [homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org//job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/115)
* [windows build is broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org//job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/171) for PR's targeting sdf4 since jenkins script is installing ignition-math3 instead of ignition-math2
* [xenial is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org//job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/43)
content.html:
CI summary:

  • homebrew is happy
  • windows build is broken for PR's targeting sdf4 since jenkins script is installing ignition-math3 instead of ignition-math2
  • xenial is happy
